details.title: October 4 COVID-19 updates
details.content: Karnataka reports over 10,000 new infections for the third time in a week and more. Read all October 4 COVID-19 updates here!

India has exceeded 140 tests per day per million population as advised by the World Health Organisation by nearly 6 times. Several states/UTs have demonstrated better performance than the national average: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare pic.twitter.com/YqnhRB0Ezv

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: 4,851: Kerala records highest-ever single-day recoveries
details.content:
• The state on Sunday recorded 4,851 recoveries, the highest single-day figures till date, even as Covid transmission remained unabated with 8,553 fresh cases being reported
  • But there have been concerns regarding the rise in the number of those on ventilator support due to Covid-related complications

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Business | 50 per cent Indians not ready to meet financial emergencies: Survey
details.content:
Family members getting Covid-19 and insecurity around job were the other top worries of most of the respondents. It also revealed that for 62 per cent of the Indians, financial immunity is equivalent to being financially prepared to tackle any uncertainty related to life and health.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | COVID-19 cases in UK crossed 5-lakh mark
details.content:
The UK passes 500,000 confirmed #coronavirus infections on Sunday, official figures show, in the latest grim milestone for the European country worst-hit by the pandemic https://t.co/JSMyFR96JU pic.twitter.com/Fe73Yez7JV

— AFP news agency (@AFP) October 5, 2020

details.title: Gobal update | Trump criticized for leaving hospital to greet supporters amid Covid treatment
details.content:
US President Donald Trump was masked as he waved from inside his bulletproof vehicle during the short trip outside Walter Reed military medical center near Washington. He tested positive for COVID-19 a few days back. 
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

The #COVID19 tally in Mizoram stands at 2120, including 1807 discharges. Active cases stand at 313. No new cases reported in the last 24 hours: Department of Information and Public Relations, Government of Mizoram pic.twitter.com/SBVbWs8qDY

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: EDITORIAL | Challenge to make COVID-19 cure affordable
details.content:
Even as deaths due to Covid-19 crossed the one lakh-mark in India, a proposal was sent to the WTO by New Delhi seeking a waiver of patents and intellectual property rights over vaccines, therapeutics and diagnostics required to deal with the pandemic.
(READ FULL EDITORIAL HERE)

details.title: 74,442 new cases push India’s COVID-19 tally past 66-lakh
details.content: Total case tally stands at 66,23,816 including 9,34,427 active cases, 55,86,704 cured/discharged/migrated cases & 1,02,685 deaths: Union Health Ministry

details.title: Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari COVID-19 count crosses 1 lakh-mark
details.content:
East Godavari became the first district in Andhra Pradesh to have breached the one lakh-mark in COVID-19 count with 826 new cases reported in the last 24 hours.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Suburban trains in Chennai open for government employees
details.content:
Government employees have been allowed to travel in suburban trains in Chennai amid the #COVID19 pandemic. Express Video | @haisat2005 @xpresstn @shibasahu2012 pic.twitter.com/VkQoqdd1tu

details.title: ‘Among Delhi government hospitals, LNJP has highest Covid recoveries’
details.content:
Lok Nayak Hospital, the largest healthcare facility under the Delhi government, which is now a dedicated coronavirus facility has so far discharged almost 8,000 recovered patients from the facility. As per the hospital administration, this is the highest number across any government hospital in the country.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: IN PICS | Hotel services resume in Maharashtra but with 50 per cent capacity
details.content:
Maharashtra: Hotels, food courts, restaurants and bars in the state resume their services today, months after they were closed in the wake of #COVID19 pandemic. The services are resuming with 50% capacity from today. Visuals from Mumbai. pic.twitter.com/qpptGSAlOk

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: Traditional Kashmiri dining finds few takers in COVID-19, social distancing times
details.content:
The COVID-19 pandemic has forced Kashmiris to temporarily forgo the age-old tradition of dining together at weddings. The large finely engraved copper plates, tramis, have given way to smaller separate plates.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

How the rapid antigen test for the #coronavirus works @AFP @AFPgraphics pic.twitter.com/KRWXqS8AUq

— AFP South Asia (@AFPSouthAsia) October 4, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 pandemic puts brakes on TB-free Karnataka plan
details.content:
The programme would involve inter-department coordination between the Rural Development and Panchayat Raj, Health, Labour, Urban Development, Woman and Child Development department, other government agencies, involving NGOs as well.

details.title: Hopes crushed: COVID-19 ruined students’ dreams of studying abroad, says survey
details.content:
Of the 1,071 Indian respondents, Bengaluru weighs 11 per cent in the sample. India ranks their higher education system as satisfactory -- whether concerning the education they personally received (86 per cent, including 43 per cent very satisfied) or current higher education system (85 per cent say it is high quality, 48 per cent fully agree).
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Odisha adds 2,617 new cases to its tally
details.content:
2,617 new #COVID19 cases, 4,108 recoveries and 17 deaths reported in Odisha till October 4. The total number of cases rises to 2,35,330 including 2,02,302 recoveries, 32,051 active cases and 924 deaths: State Health Department

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 tally in India breaches 66-lakh mark with single-day spike of 74,442 new cases
details.content:
India's COVID-19 caseload went past 66 lakh, while the number of people who have recuperated from the disease surged to 55,86,703, pushing the recovery rate to 84.34 per cent, according to Union Health Ministry data updated on Monday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: South Korea reports coronavirus numbers trending lower
details.content:
South Korea has reported 73 new cases of the coronavirus, its fifth straight day of below 100, although officials expressed concern that could rise because of increased travel during a five-day holiday period that ended Sunday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Employee killed, two patients injured in freak mishap at Tirupati COVID hospital
details.content:
In the early hours of the day, a part of the sunshade of the window in the newly constructed building block of Padmavati COVID Hospital attached to SVIMS collapsed and fell on Radhika and two others who were there underneath the window. Radhika died on the spot, while two others were injured.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: '828 COVID-19 tests per day per million population'
details.content:
India has exceeded the 140 tests per day for per million population, as advised by the World Health Organization (WHO) for comprehensive surveillance, of COVID-19 by nearly six times, said the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) on Monday.

#IndiaFightsCorona

India crosses a Significant Milestone.

Active Cases continue to be less than 10 lakh for Two Unbroken Weeks.https://t.co/w52tr6W3MW pic.twitter.com/N23YiY6NBm

— Ministry of Health (@MoHFW_INDIA) October 5, 2020

details.title: Congress MP Abu Hasem Khan Choudhury tests positive for COVID-19, admitted to hospital
details.content:
The condition Congress MP Abu Hasem Khan Choudhury, who was brought to a Kolkata-based hospital on September 28 after he tested positive for the disease, is "critical", officials said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Unlock 5: Uttarakhand relaxes cap on daily pilgrims for Char Dham, e-passes to continue
details.content:
In another step to ensure hassle- free religious tourism in the state, the Uttarakhand government on Sunday increased the number of pilgrims allowed daily at Char Dham shrines- Kedarnath Badrinath, Gangotri and Yamunotri.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

Kedarnath temple in Uttarakhand. (File | PTI)

details.title: Covaxin to use ViroVax's adjuvant Alhydroxiquim-II to boost immune response
details.content:
Vaccine maker Bharat Biotech on Monday announced its novel coronavirus vaccine (under development) Covaxin, which was approved for human trials, will use adjuvant Alhydroxiquim-II to boost immune response and longer lasting immunity.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Active COVID cases in India remain under 10-lakh mark for two weeks
details.content:
• Crossing a landmark milestone, the number of active COVID-19 cases in India has remained below the 10 lakh mark for 14 days unabated
  • The Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Monday that new recoveries have exceeded the new cases in the recent days
  • While 76,737 recoveries have been registered in the last 24 hours in the country, only 74,442 the new confirmed cases have been reported in the same period

(Inputs from ANI)

details.title: 1,430 new COVID-19 cases in Thane; tally reaches 1,81,499
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in Thane reached 1,81,499 with the addition of 1,430 new cases in the Maharashtra district, an official said on Monday. The district also reported 30 deaths due to COVID-19 on Sunday, taking the toll to 4,589, he said.

details.title: Worried about present, despairing over future, sex workers fight for survival in age of social distancing
details.content: Will life ever get back to normal? As COVID-19 continues to spread, it's a question that haunts all sectors of society but perhaps sex workers most of all with the fear of being pushed further into the shadows in an age of social distancing darkening their present and clouding the future.

details.title: 44 new COVID-19 cases detected in Ladakh
details.content: Forty-four new cases of coronavirus were detected in Ladakh, taking the infection tally in the Union Territory to 4,521, officials said on Monday. With 39 more patients cured of the contagion, the number of active cases in the region stands at 1,106 - 773 in Leh district and 333 in Kargil district, the officials said.

details.title: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to soon decide on reopening places of worship: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut
details.content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray is holding discussions with various religious organisations and he will soon take a decision on reopening places of worship in the state, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said on Monday.

details.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal launches anti-air pollution campaign, says polluted air can be life threatening in view COVID
details.content: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday launched a mega anti-air pollution campaign, saying polluted air can be life threatening in view of the COVID-19 pandemic. Under the campaign 'Yudh Pradushan ke Virudh', separate plans have been prepared for each of the 13 pollution hotspots in the city, Kejriwal said during a digital press conference.

details.title: We have taken first step to restart football activities: AIFF president Praful Patel
details.content: The ISL backed by the AIFF, in all likelihood, will be the first sporting competition in the country after a phased opening of the lockdown. (READ MORE)

details.title: Compensation to kin if patient dies due to hospital laxity: Bombay High Court
details.content: The Bombay High Court said if a COVID-19 patient dies in a state or civic-run hospital due to culpable negligence on part of the medical facility, then his/her family members would be entitled for compensation. A division bench of Chief Justice Dipankar Datta and Justice N J Jamadar said the state government has a duty and responsibility towards its citizens.

details.title: Delhi HC asks MHA to decide plea for college students to stay in hostels during exams
details.content: The Delhi High Court has asked the Ministry of Home Affairs to consider the representation of a parents body seeking directions to allow final year students of various universities to stay in hostels or paying guest accommodations, closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, during the exams.

details.title: Domestic tennis circuit to resume from November 16
details.content: Competitive tennis will make a return after an eight-month COVID-19 hiatus as the All India Tennis Association on Monday announced the resumption of the domestic circuit from November 16. (READ MORE)

details.title: Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur home quarantined self for three days
details.content: Himachal Cm Jai Ram Thakur has decided to keep himself in home quarantine for three days as a precautionary measure against COVID, an official spokesperson said. The spokesperson said the Chief Minister had on October 3 met some persons in Manali, who tested positive for coronavirus infection on Sunday.

details.title: SpiceJet to start flights from India to London from December 4
details.content: SpiceJet on Monday said it will operate non-stop flights connecting Delhi and Mumbai with London from December 4. In a press release, the airline said it is the first Indian low-cost carrier to operate flights to the UK. The Delhi-London flight and the Mumbai-London flight will operate under the air bubble agreement with the UK, it noted.

details.title: 127 cops tested positive for COVID19 in the last 24 hours: Maharashtra Police
details.content:
127 police personnel tested positive for #COVID19 in the last 24 hours & 1 died, taking total positive cases to 24,150 in the force including 21,179 recoveries, 2,720 active cases, and 251 deaths: Maharashtra Police pic.twitter.com/RS0TfDVD9K

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: 907 new COVID-19 cases have been reported on October 4 in Bihar
details.content: 907 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported on October 4. Taking total count of active cases in Bihar to 12,833: State Health Department

details.title: Female worker dies at Tirupati's SVIMS COVID hospital last night
details.content:
Andhra Pradesh: A female worker died at Tirupati's Sri Venkateswara Institute of Medical Sciences (SVIMS) COVID hospital last night after debris from an under-construction floor fell on her. 2 patients were also injured. AP Health Minister announced ex-gratia to deceased's family pic.twitter.com/7Y69wWfBfS

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: 220-bedded facility has been dedicated as a COVID Hospital to nation: Ministry of Health
details.content: Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan along with Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath digitally inaugurated Super Speciality Block (SSB) at Motilal Nehru Medical College, Prayagraj. The 220-bedded facility has been dedicated as a COVID Hospital (DCH) to nation: Ministry of Health

details.title: In the last 24 hours, 3064 new COVID-19 cases were reported in Uttar Pradesh
details.content:
In the last 24 hours, 3064 new #COVID19 cases were reported in the state. Active cases stand at 45024 while 3,66,321 people have been discharged- out of which 4269 were discharged in the last 24 hours: Uttar Pradesh Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan Prasad pic.twitter.com/IL4hpyWjp1

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) October 5, 2020

details.title: Himachal Pradesh reports 12 new COVID-19 cases since 9 pm bulletin yesterday
details.content: Himachal Pradesh reports 12 new COVID-19 cases, 180 cured cases & 3 deaths since 9 pm bulletin yesterday. Total positive cases in the state stand at 15,863, including 12,521 recoveries, 3,102 active cases & 215 deaths: State Health Department, Govt of Himachal Pradesh

details.title: 194 new COVID-19 cases reported in Puducherry today
details.content:
194 new #COVID19 cases, 458 discharges, and 4 deaths reported in Puducherry today, taking the total number of positive cases to 29,277 so far, including 4,513 active cases, 24,221 recovered cases & 543 deaths till date: State Health Department, Govt of Puducherry pic.twitter.com/bQnN3qHz5Y

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: Therapeutic, diagnostics & vaccines for whole world, only way out of this pandemic: WHO Executive Board Chairman
details.content: Therapeutic, diagnostics & vaccines for whole world, only way out of this pandemic. Global collaboration is paramount. Strengthening emergency preparedness & risk management, key to addressing health risk posed by emerging diseases: WHO Executive Board Chairman Dr Harsh Vardhan

details.title: Kangra DC cured of COVID-19, announces new guidelines for incoming tourists
details.content: After recovering from coronavirus infection, Kangra Deputy Commissioner Rakesh Prajapati joined back for duty on Monday at his office in Dharamshala after quarantining for more than three weeks.

details.title: No assessment till up to 2-3 weeks of reopening: Ministry of Education
details.content: Assessment to be learner-friendly & involving different formats rather than pen-paper test. No assessment till up to 2-3 weeks of reopening. Online learning to be encouraged. SOP provides for guidelines on ensuring emotion well being of students & teachers: Ministry of Education

details.title: Hotels, food courts, restaurants and bars in Maharashtra resume dine-in services
details.content:
Maharashtra: Hotels, food courts, restaurants & bars in the state resume dine-in services from today with 50% capacity

"We have started after a very long time. It'll take a while for normalcy to return. We're taking precautions which the govt has prescribed," says a hotel owner pic.twitter.com/uRxEeVvrDe

— ANI (@ANI) October 5, 2020

details.title: Jammu and Kashmir Congress chief GA Mir??????? calls for immediate steps to meet COVID-19 challenge
details.content: The Jammu and Kashmir Pradesh Congress Committee chief GA Mir on Monday criticised the Union Territory administration over its response to the prevailing COVID-19 situation and demanded necessary steps to restore confidence of people in the health system.

details.title: Tripura reports 159 new COVID-19 cases, six more fatalities
details.content: At least 159 more people tested positive for COVID-19 in Tripura on Monday, pushing the tally in the state to 27,033, a health department official said. The death toll rose to 296 with six more people succumbing to the infection, he said. West Tripura district, of which state capital Agartala is a part, has accounted for 159 of the 296 COVID-19 deaths, the official said.

details.title: 19 new COVID-19 cases reported in Dharavi
details.content: 19 new COVID-19 cases reported in Dharavi area of Mumbai today, taking the total number of cases to 3,258 including 185 active cases and 2,781 discharges: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation

details.title: 5,042 fresh cases reported in Kerala on Monday
details.content:
#tniecovidupdate
5,042 fresh cases reported in #Kerala on Monday, only 38,696 samples were tested. @MSKiranPrakash @COVID19centre @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/2yTrQmuCz1

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) October 5, 2020

details.title: Karnataka prohibits strike by doctors, health staff
details.content: The Karnataka government has prohibited strikes, non-cooperation and any other form of disobedience by public servants and health workers engaged in providing health services related to COVID-19.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh records 63 more COVID-19 deaths, 3,064 new cases
details.content: The COVID-19 death toll in Uttar Pradesh reached 6,092 on Monday with 63 fatalities, while 3,064 fresh cases pushed the infection tally to 4,17,437, an official said. A total of 3,66,321 patients have been discharged from hospitals after recovering from the infection, Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Amit Mohan Prasad said.

details.title: Mizoram reported 30 new recovered COVID-19 cases today
details.content: Mizoram reported 30 new recovered COVID-19 cases today. The total positive cases stand at 2,120, including 1,837 discharges, 283 active cases & no COVID death till date in the state: Department of Information and Public Relations, Govt of Mizoram

details.title: Dasara festivities to be simple in Karnataka: Medical Education Minister Dr K Sudhakar
details.content: Karnataka will organise a simple yet meaningful Dasara celebration to avoid spurt in COVID-19 cases as was the case in neighboring Kerala during Onam, Medical Education Minister Dr K Sudhakar said on Monday.

details.title: Jammu and Kashmir reports 632 new COVID-19 cases and 1,386 recoveries today
details.content: Jammu and Kashmir reports 632 new COVID-19 cases and 1,386 recoveries today, taking the total tally in the Union Territory to 79,738, including 63,790 recoveries and 1,252 deaths. Active cases stand at 14,696: Government of Jammu and Kashmir

details.title: Schools must ensure smooth transition from home-based schooling to formal schooling: Education Ministry
details.content: The Education Ministry released guidelines on Monday for reopening schools, which included thorough cleaning and disinfection of premises, flexibility in attendance, no assessment for up to three weeks and ensuring smooth transition from home-based schooling during COVID-19 lockdown to formal schooling.

details.title: COVID impact on GST
details.content: Nobody is going to be denied the compensation which has arisen out of implementation of GST and COVID impact. A discussion with States is on. Around 20 States have written that they opt for Option 1: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman

details.content:
Maharashtra reports 10,244 new #COVID19 cases, 263 deaths and 12,982 discharges today. Total cases in the state rise to 14,53,653, including 38,347 deaths and 11,62,585 discharges. Active cases stand at 2,52,277: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/HHRcqY8H1T

details.title: Gujarat records 1,327 new COVID-19 cases, 1,405 recoveries
details.content: The coronavirus tally in Gujarat rose to 1,44,027 with the addition of 1,327 new cases on Monday, the state health department said. The death toll increased to 3,512 with 13 more patients succumbing to the viral infection, it said. At the same time, 1,405 COVID-19 patients were discharged on Monday, taking the number of recovered cases to 1,23,770, the health department said.

details.title: 7501 new cases reported in Karnataka
details.content: Karnataka reported 7,051 new COVID-19 cases, 7,064 discharges and 84 deaths today, taking total cases to 6,47,712 including 5,22,846 discharges and 9,370 deaths. Number of active cases stands at 1,15,477: State Health Department
